n_debug_mem.c

00001 /*!\file n_debug_mem.c
00002  * Helpers for debugging memory
00003  *\author Castagnier Mickael
00004  *\date 2014-10-10
00005  */
00006 
00007 #include "nilorea/n_debug_mem.h"
00008 
00009 /*! global table of allocation */
00010 static DEBUG_MEM_TABLE __debug_mem_table ;
00011 
00012 
00013 /*!\fn int init_debug_mem()
00014  *\brief initialize debug tables
00015  *\return TRUE or FALSE 
00016  */
00017 int init_debug_mem()
00018 {
00019    __debug_mem_table . nb_malloc = 0 ;
00020    __debug_mem_table . nb_free = 0 ;
00021 
00022    /* A huge table because there could be a ton of memory allocation */
00023    __debug_mem_table . table = new_ht( 1048576 );
00024    if( ! __debug_mem_table . table )
00025    {
00026       n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to allocate a 1048576 item hash table" );
00027       return FALSE ;
00028    }
00029 
00030    if( pthread_mutex_init( &__debug_mem_table . lock , NULL ) != 0 )
00031    {
00032       n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to initialize lock" );
00033       return FALSE ;
00034    }
00035 
00036    return TRUE ;
00037 } /* init_debuf_mem() */
00038 
00039 
00040 
00041 /*!\fn DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *new_db_mem_item( void *ptr , size_t size , int line , char *file , char *func )
00042  *\brief allocate a new item in the debug table
00043  *\param ptr Pointer address to save
00044  *\param size the size of the allocated data
00045  *\param line line of the allocation
00046  *\param file file of the allocation
00047  *\param func function where the allocation was made
00048  *\return A new item or NULL
00049  */
00050 DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *new_db_mem_item( void *ptr , size_t size , int line , char *file , char *func )
00051 {
00052    DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *item = NULL ;
00053 
00054    item = (DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *)calloc( 1 , sizeof( DEBUG_MEM_ITEM ) );
00055    if( !item )
00056    {
00057       n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to allocate a DEBUG_MEM_ITEM" );
00058       return NULL ;
00059    }
00060    item -> ptr = ptr ;
00061    item -> size = size ;
00062    item -> line = line ;
00063    item -> file = file ;
00064    item -> func = func ;
00065 
00066    return item ;
00067 } /* new_db_item() */
00068 
00069 
00070 
00071 /*!\fn void delete_db_mem_item( void *item )
00072  *\brief delete a debug meme item
00073  *\param item the item to destroy
00074  */
00075 void delete_db_mem_item( void *ptr )
00076 {
00077    DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *item = (DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *)ptr ;  
00078    if( item )
00079    {
00080       FreeNoLog( item -> file );
00081       FreeNoLog( item -> func );
00082       FreeNoLog( item );
00083    }
00084 } /* delete_db_mem_item */
00085

00088 /*!\fn void *db_mem_alloc( size_t size , int line , char *file , const char *func )
00089  *\brief allocate a new pointer with size and also put it in the debug table
00090  *\param size the size of the allocated data
00091  *\param line line of the allocation
00092  *\param file file of the allocation
00093  *\param func function where the allocation was made
00094  *\return A new item or NULL
00095  */
00096 void *db_mem_alloc( size_t size , int line , char *file , const char *func )
00097 {
00098    DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *item = NULL ;
00099    char key[ 512 ] = "";
00100    void *ptr = NULL ;
00101 
00102    __debug_mem_table . nb_malloc ++ ;
00103 
00104    ptr = calloc( 1 , size );
00105    if( ptr )
00106    {
00107       item = new_db_mem_item( ptr , size , line , strdup( file ) , strdup( func ) );
00108       sprintf( key , "%p" , ptr );
00109       ht_put_ptr( __debug_mem_table . table , key , item , delete_db_mem_item );
00110       n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Added %p size %zu file %s func %s line %d" , item -> ptr , item -> size , item -> file , item -> func , item -> line );
00111    }
00112    else
00113    {
00114       n_log( LOG_ERR , "Unable to allocate %d oct at file %s func %s line %d " , size , file , func , line );
00115    }
00116    return ptr ;
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 
00121 /*!\fn void *db_malloc( size_t size )
00122  *\brief return a new allocated element 
00123  *\param size the size of the element
00124  *\return Allocated delement or NULL
00125  */
00126 void *db_malloc( size_t size )
00127 {
00128    return db_mem_alloc( size , __LINE__, __FILE__, __func__ );
00129 } /* db_malloc */
00130 
00131 
00132 
00133 /*!\fn void *db_mem_free( void *ptr )
00134  *\brief Free a pointer and also remove it from debug table 
00135  *\param ptr Pointer to free
00136  */
00137 void db_mem_free( void *ptr )
00138 {
00139    void *hashptr = NULL ; 
00140    char key[ 512 ] = "";
00141 
00142    sprintf( key , "%p" , ptr );
00143    ht_get_ptr( __debug_mem_table . table , key , &hashptr );
00144    if( hashptr )
00145    {
00146       DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *item = hashptr ;
00147       n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Removed %p size %zu file %s func %s line %d" , item -> ptr , item -> size , item -> file , item -> func , item -> line );
00148       delete_db_mem_item( item );
00149       item = NULL ;
00150       ht_remove( __debug_mem_table . table , key );
00151       __debug_mem_table . nb_free ++ ;
00152    }
00153    Free( ptr );
00154 } /* db_mem_free() */

00158 /*!\fn int db_mem_dump_leaked( char *file )
00159  *\brief Dump the current debug memory table
00160  *\param file The name of the logfile
00161  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00162  */
00163 int db_mem_dump_leaked( char *file )
00164 {
00165    FILE *out = NULL ;
00166    LIST_NODE *node = NULL ;
00167    HASH_NODE *hash_entry = NULL ;
00168    DEBUG_MEM_ITEM *item = NULL ;
00169    size_t len = 0 ;
00170 
00171    out = fopen( file , "w" );
00172    if( !out )
00173    {
00174       n_log( LOG_ERR ,"Unable to open %s" , file );
00175       return FALSE ;
00176    }
00177 
00178    fprintf( out , "%d malloc / %d free\n" , __debug_mem_table . nb_malloc , __debug_mem_table . nb_free );
00179 
00180    for( int it = 0 ; it < __debug_mem_table . table -> size ; it ++ )
00181    {
00182       node =  __debug_mem_table . table -> hash_table[ it ] -> start ;
00183       while( node )
00184       {
00185          hash_entry= (HASH_NODE *)node -> ptr ;
00186          item = hash_entry -> data . ptr ;
00187 
00188          if( item )
00189          {
00190             fprintf( out , "%p size %zu file %s func %s line %d dump:" , item -> ptr , item -> size , item -> file , item -> func , item -> line );
00191             if( item -> size > DEBUG_MEM_DUMP_MAX_LEN )
00192                len = DEBUG_MEM_DUMP_MAX_LEN ;
00193             else
00194                len = item -> size ;
00195 
00196             fwrite( item -> ptr , len , 1 , out );
00197             fprintf( out , "\n" );
00198             delete_db_mem_item( item );
00199             item = NULL ;
00200          }
00201          else
00202          {
00203             n_log( LOG_ERR  ,"Unable to load item from node -> ptr" );
00204          }
00205          node = node -> next ;
00206       }
00207    }
00208 
00209    fclose( out );
00210    n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "Memory dump finished" );
00211    return TRUE ;
00212 } /*db_mem_dump_leaked() */
